node.title: It's 'here they come, ready or not' for Tasmania as border opens
node.alt: two police in high vis vests stand back-on to the camera at Hobart Airport
node.description: After almost two years of living the hermit life, Tasmania isÂ open again to visitors and returning locals, but whether residents of the island state are ready or not for COVID-19 is another matter entirely.
node.content:
["Tasmania's borders have been officially flung open overnight, with the state now welcoming\u00a0visitors from COVID-19\u00a0hotspots after 21 months of restrictions.", "Hobart Airport is set to receive more than 30 interstate flights throughout Wednesday, including from hotspot areas Melbourne, Sydney and Canberra.", "The first flight from Melbourne touched down in Hobart around 7:35am.", "As many as 13\u00a0flights will make their way into Launceston, including seven originating from Melbourne.", "The first Spirit of Tasmania sailing from Melbourne docked in Devonport this morning, and an extra sailing has been added today.\u00a0", "Among the passengers was Andrew Brown who told ABC's AM\u00a0program he was excited to be reunited with family.", "\"Our son and two granddaughters are down in Hobart and I haven't seen them since the beginning of the year \u2026\u00a0 my wife is following me on the plane in a week's time and she hasn't seen\u00a0them since the start of COVID, so Christmas in Hobart,\" he said.", "It's not just new arrivals who will notice the changes. Just under 300 people who had been confined to quarantine were released at the stroke of midnight.\u00a0", "Tasmania's border reopening comes with the state having fully vaccinated 90 per cent of those residents aged over 16 years.\u00a0", "However, just 65 per cent of the 12-15 age group have received two doses to date.\u00a0", "", "
Hobart Airport is expecting a busy day.(ABC News: Luke Bowden\u00a0)
", "According to Premier Peter Gutwein, Tasmania will reopen as \"one of the most vaccinated places on the planet\".", "Public Health Director Mark Veitch said Tasmania had achieved a \"great\" level of vaccination coverage.\u00a0", "\"That offers us far greater protection from COVID than we would have been at if the vaccination coverage had been, say, 80 per cent,\" Dr Veitch said.\u00a0", "Travellers to Tasmania will remain subject to some isolation and testing requirements, some of which the Government was still tinkering with as late as Monday.\u00a0", "People who return to Tasmania from hotspots after fewer than seven days away will need to get a COVID-19 PCR\u00a0test within 24 hours of arrival, but will not need to isolate while awaiting the results\u00a0unless they are symptomatic.\u00a0", "Those who spend longer interstate before coming to Tasmania will need a negative PCR test no more than 72 hours before travel, if they have spent any time in a high-risk area within the previous 14 days.\u00a0", "International arrivals will be required to quarantine for seven days, and to undergo two tests.", "Travellers who are eligible will also need to have been vaccinated.", "Anyone at all who comes into Tasmania will need to have registered on the Tas e-Travel website and scan their pass as they enter.\u00a0", "Mr Gutwein said travellers would face \"numerous checks\" to ensure they were clear on the rules, and extra biosecurity staff would be placed at interstate airports to provide information on the requirements.\u00a0", "\"There will be additional police presence at our borders\u00a0and, if you try to enter without meeting our requirements, you can face substantial fines or even imprisonment,\" Mr Gutwein said.\u00a0", "More information on the current restrictions can be found\u00a0on the Tasmanian government's coronavirus website.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
